titleStmt.title: Robert Dougherty et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Scott County Ky Nov 1863
To his Excelency the Govenor of Kentucky

Your Petitioners would Respectfully Represent. That at the November Term of the Scott Circuit Court for 1863. Jeremiah Haner was Fined to the Extent of the law the charge against Said Haner was Selling whiskey to a Slave without an order. the selling of said whiskey is Said to have taken place in the year 1860 The proof against Said Haner was that the Negro Boy Jack was seen to come from the house of Said Haner with a bottle of whiskey. Said Haner has been ready for Trial at all the courts Since he was Indicted. and would have been present at the last Term of Said Court but for the fact that the only witness the Commonwealth had was M. U. Sinclair and said Sinclair told Said Haner a day or two before Said court that he would not be there to testify that the cause had been continued from court to court Since 1860 on account of the absence of Said witness. Said Haner has been ever Since the Inditments ^Redy^ to prove by R. G. Johnson that Said Johnson bought the whiskey alluded to and went ^out^ of Said Haner house and gave to Said Negro Jack the Bottle found in his possesion For these considerations we would Pray his Excelency to Remit Said Fine

Robert Dougherty
French C Johnson
R G Johnson
J W Sinclair
W H Poindexter
S. W. Marston
W. D Poindexter
B S Newton
John L. Branham
Alvin Sinclair
T. D Jones
O. C. Bradley
J Y Bond
A. M. Ferguson
J Q Adams
John A Davison
R. S. Triplett
B N Bradford
Elridge Branham
John Wayt
F. G. Johnson
J. B. Kelly
H. Martin
N Calvert
Henry Harvey
